Project.Brief history of your project and organi: OpenNeuro started in 2011 to help researchers share brain imaging data and support reproducible science. In 2018, expanding to include more types of brain scans like MRI, EEG, and MEG. It uses a standard format called BIDS to make data easy to share and reuse. Today, OpenNeuro hosts hundreds of datasets and is supported by major research groups like the NIH, helping scientists around the world work together more openly and effectively.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File: OpenNeuro stores over 600 neuroimaging datasets, primarily MRI data (like fMRI, structural, and diffusion MRI). These datasets, include over 500 terabytes from sources like OpenNeuro, ABIDE, and NeuroVault.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: The data is first split into smaller segments, secured through encryption, and distributed across multiple storage nodes to ensure dependability. Prior to this, the data must be uploaded and assigned a unique Content Identifier (CID) for tracking purposes. The storage system oversees all stages of the process, including initial setup, data locking, and final validation, while consistently producing cryptographic proofs to verify data integrity. With the CID, the original data can be effortlessly retrieved, decrypted, and accessed when required.
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: Greater China, Asia other than Greater China, Africa, North America, Europe, South America, Australia (continent)
Project.How will you be distributing your data t: HTTP or FTP server, IPFS, Venus built-in data transfer, Lotus built-in data transfer, I don't know yet
